text: Let X and Y be two independent random variables. If E, V and C denote the expectation, variance and covariance, respectively then how many of the following statement is/are true? [Assume a and b are constants] (a) E(XY) = E(X).E(Y) (b) C(X, Y) = V(a + b); (0) V(aX + bY) = a2V(X) + b2V(Y) (d) E(Y?) = [EX)PIEN]?
